required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Nutritional Ketosis in VLCAD Deficiency
clinical_study.official_title: Acute Nutritional Ketosis in VLCAD Deficiency: Testing the Metabolic Base for Therapeutic Use

collaborator.agency: Academisch Medisch Centrum - Universiteit van Amsterdam (AMC-UvA)

brief_summary.textblock: To test if a ketone-ester based drink can boost muscle mitochondrial function in vivo in patients with VLCADD in order to establish a rational basis for therapeutic use in this disorder.

detailed_description.textblock:
Exertional rhabdomyolysis is a common symptom in very long-chain acylCoA dehydrogenase deficient (VLCADD) patients. Failing muscle ATP homeostasis, due to impaired fatty acid oxidation, is the most likely cause. Therefore, supplementation with an alternative energy substrate to boost ATP homeostasis, such as an exogenous ketone ester (KE) drink, could be a therapeutic option. Previous results suggest that KE is preferentially oxidized in the tricyclic acid (TCA) cycle and improves physical endurance in athletes. Our primary objective is to test if KE boosts muscular ATP homeostasis in VLCADD patients to establish a rational basis for therapeutic use.
VLCADD patients will be included in a randomized, blinded, placebo controlled, 2-way cross-over trial. Prior to each test, patients receive a KE drink or an isocaloric carbohydrate equivalent, and completed a 35 min cycling test on an upright bicycle, followed by 10 minutes of supine cycling inside a MR scanner. The protocol will be repeated after at least one week with the opposite drink.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: randomized, blinded, placebo controlled, 2-way cross-over trial

primary_outcome.measure: Change of ATP concentration in millimolar
primary_outcome.time_frame: During session 2 and 3: continuous measurements from t=75 minutes until t=85 minutes
primary_outcome.description: steady-state in vivo intramuscular concentration of ATP metabolites during rest and exercise.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of PCr concentration in millimolar
primary_outcome.time_frame: During session 2 and 3: continuous measurements from t=75 minutes until t=85 minutes
primary_outcome.description: steady-state in vivo intramuscular concentration of ATP metabolites during rest and exercise.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of Pi concentration in millimolar
primary_outcome.time_frame: During session 2 and 3: continuous measurements from t=75 minutes until t=85 minutes
primary_outcome.description: steady-state in vivo intramuscular concentration of ATP metabolites during rest and exercise.

secondary_outcome.measure: kinetic rate constant of ATP synthesis in Hertz
secondary_outcome.description: rate constant of Pi and PCr recovery post-exercise

secondary_outcome.measure: intramuscular concentration of H+ in millimolar
secondary_outcome.description: steady-state in vivo intramuscular concentration of H+ during rest and exercise

secondary_outcome.measure: completion of 35 minute upright bicycling bout at FATMAX
secondary_outcome.description: (yes/no; if no, #minutes)

secondary_outcome.measure: completion of 10 minute supine bicycling bout at FATMAX in scanner
secondary_outcome.description: (yes/no; if no, #minutes)

secondary_outcome.measure: HR in beats per minute
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During session 1, 15 minutes During Session 2 + 3: 35 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: heart rate, VO2 and VCO2 dynamics. During session 2+3 breath sampling will be done for 2 minutes per timepoint, simultaneously with blood sampling.

secondary_outcome.measure: VO2 in milliliter per minute per kilogram
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During session 1, 15 minutes During Session 2 + 3: 35 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: heart rate, VO2 and VCO2 dynamics. During session 2+3 breath sampling will be done for 2 minutes per timepoint, simultaneously with blood sampling.

secondary_outcome.measure: VCO2 in milliliter per minute per kilogram
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During session 1, 15 minutes During Session 2 + 3: 35 minutes
secondary_outcome.description: VCO2 dynamics during session 2+3 breath sampling for 2 minutes per timepoint, simultaneously with blood sampling.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood metabolites: D-betahydroxybutyrate in millimol per liter
secondary_outcome.description: Samples are taken at baseline, 30 minutes, 40 minutes, 50 minutes, 60 minutes, 75 minutes, 85 minutes and 265 minutes after ingestion of the testdrink

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood metabolites: glucose in millimol per liter
secondary_outcome.description: Samples are taken at baseline, 30 minutes, 40 minutes, 50 minutes, 60 minutes, 75 minutes, 85 minutes and 265 min after ingestion of the testdrink

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood metabolites: lactate in millimol per liter
secondary_outcome.description: Samples are taken at baseline, 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 85 minutes and 265 min after ingestion of the testdrink

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood metabolites: insulin in picomol per liter
secondary_outcome.description: Samples are taken at baseline, 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 85 minutes and 265 min after ingestion of the testdrink

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood metabolites: creatine kinase in units per liter
secondary_outcome.description: Samples are taken at baseline, 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 85 minutes and 265 min after ingestion of the testdrink

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood metabolites: triglycerides in millimol per liter
secondary_outcome.description: Samples are taken at baseline, 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 85 minutes and 265 min after ingestion of the testdrink

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood metabolites: LDL cholesterol in millimol per liter
secondary_outcome.description: Samples are taken at baseline, 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 85 minutes and 265 min after ingestion of the testdrink

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood metabolites: free fatty acids in millimol per liter
secondary_outcome.description: Samples are taken at baseline, 30 minutes, 40 minutes, 50 minutes, 60 minutes, 75 minutes, 85 minutes and 265 min after ingestion of the test drink

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood metabolites: total cholesterol in millimol per liter
secondary_outcome.description: Samples are taken at baseline, 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 85 minutes and 265 min after ingestion of the testdrink

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood metabolites: HDL cholesterol in millimol per liter
secondary_outcome.description: Samples are taken at baseline, 30 minutes, 60 minutes, 85 minutes and 265 min after ingestion of the testdrink

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in blood metabolites: acylcarnitines in micromol per liter
secondary_outcome.description: Samples are taken at baseline, 30 minutes, 40 minutes, 50 minutes, 60 minutes, 75 minutes, 85 minutes and 265 min after ingestion of the test drink

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjective exertion
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During Session 2 + 3, assessed during blood sampling, 265 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: Measured with Borg score (range from 6 (rest) to 20 (extreme exertion)).

secondary_outcome.measure: height in meters
secondary_outcome.description: height of patient

secondary_outcome.measure: weight in kilogram
secondary_outcome.description: weight of patient to dose intervention and normalize outcome parameters

secondary_outcome.measure: BMI in kg/m^2
secondary_outcome.description: weight and height will be combined to report BMI in kg/m^2

secondary_outcome.measure: optional: TCA intermediates in muscle tissue (units is ratio of metabolite peak/ internal standard) and will be expressed as fold change from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Session 2+3: before and after exercise, 20 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: metabolomics (mass spectrometry) of muscle tissue on a voluntary basis

secondary_outcome.measure: optional: glycolysis intermediates in muscle tissue (units is ratio of metabolite peak/ internal standard) and will be expressed as fold change from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Session 2+3: before and after exercise, 20 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: metabolomics (mass spectrometry) of muscle tissue on a voluntary basis

secondary_outcome.measure: optional: acylcarnitines in muscle tissue (units is ratio of metabolite peak/ internal standard) and will be expressed as fold change from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Session 2+3: before and after exercise, 20 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: metabolomics (mass spectrometry) of muscle tissue on a voluntary basis

secondary_outcome.measure: optional: D-betahydroxybutyrate in muscle tissue (units is ratio of metabolite peak/ internal standard) and will be expressed as fold change from baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Session 2+3: before and after exercise, 20 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: metabolomics (mass spectrometry) of muscle tissue on a voluntary basis

secondary_outcome.measure: optional: capillary density in muscle tissue based on CD31 staining (capillaries per millimeter^2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Session 2+3: before and after exercise, 20 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: individual phenotypic muscle properties on a voluntary basis. Immunohistochemistry.

secondary_outcome.measure: optional: mitochondrial density based on ATPase, COX-SDH, SDH and NADH staining (intensity per microgram per minute).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Session 2+3: before and after exercise, 20 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: individual phenotypic muscle properties on a voluntary basis. Immunohistochemistry.

secondary_outcome.measure: optional: mitochondrial density based on as citrate synthase activity expressed as absorbance/s/mg.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Session 2+3: before and after exercise, 20 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: individual phenotypic muscle properties on a voluntary basis.

secondary_outcome.measure: optional: parameters for metabolism and mitochondrial function in muscle (AMPK, PPAR gamma, PGC1a, and GLUT4). All expressed as protein content as % of control.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Session 2+3: before and after exercise, 20 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: individual phenotypic muscle properties on a voluntary basis. Westernblots.

secondary_outcome.measure: optional: lipid accumulation based on Oil-Red-O staining (intensity of staining, and percentage positive-stained cells).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Session 2+3: before and after exercise, 20 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: individual phenotypic muscle properties on a voluntary basis. Immunohistochemistry.

secondary_outcome.measure: optional: muscle fiber type composition based on myosin heavy chain profiling. Type I, IIa, IIx fibres will be expressed as % of total fibres.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Session 2+3: before and after exercise, 20 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: individual phenotypic muscle properties on a voluntary basis.

secondary_outcome.measure: optional: muscle fiber type composition based on ATPase staining (intensity/ug/min). Type I, IIa, IIx fibres will be expressed as % of total fibres.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Session 2+3: before and after exercise, 20 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: individual phenotypic muscle properties on a voluntary basis. Immunohistochemistry.

secondary_outcome.measure: optional: glycogen content of muscle based on Periodic acid-Schiff (PAS) staining (intensity per millimeter^2)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Session 2+3: before and after exercise, 20 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: individual phenotypic muscle properties on a voluntary basis. Immunohistochemistry.

secondary_outcome.measure: optional: glycogen content of muscle measured as glucose released after enzymatic digestion with amyloglucosidase expressed as micromol per gram wet muscle weight.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Session 2+3: before and after exercise, 20 minutes per session
secondary_outcome.description: individual phenotypic muscle properties on a voluntary basis.

arm_group.description: Oral intake of ketone ester drink muscle biopsy exercise muscle biopsy Magnetic Resonance imaging
Oral intake of isocaloric carbohydrate drinkmuscle biopsy exercise muscle biopsy Magnetic Resonance imaging

intervention.description: 35 min cycling test on an upright bicycle, followed by 10 minutes of supine cycling inside a MR scanner.
biopsy from the quadriceps muscle prior to and immediately after upright bicycling
1H MR images and 31P MR spectra were acquired from the upper leg prior to-, during and after exercise

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed VLCADD by genetic profiling
Exclusion Criteria:
- contraindications for MRI studies (assessed by standardised questionnaire as previously used in METC 08-267/K; see UMCG section F METC documents)
- inability to perform bicycle exercise.
- recent episode of rhabdomyolysis, or treatment for acute renal failure in the past 2 months.
- intercurrent illness which may influence exercise tolerance (anaemia, musculoskeletal injury, or other undiagnosed illness under investigation).
- known coronary artery disease, positive history for angina, or changes on ECG suggestive of previous ischaemia without a negative stress test.
- insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus.
- loss of, or an inability to give informed consent.
- pregnancy or current breastfeeding, or females not taking the oral contraceptive pill (this is due to the variability in hormonal patterns and substrate levels with different parts of the menstrual cycle).
- any other cause which in the opinion of the investigators, may affect the volunteers ability to participate in the study.

overall_official.affiliation: Dept of Neuroscience/ Neuroimaging Center Groningen
